Actually it has notthing to do with self doubt. Rodimus is definitly
not doubting himself in this. He is pretty much back to his old self
again. However Tuscon is asking Rodimus to work with people who had
only recently did worse than kill him - they stripped him of his old
identity and made him into a monster and had him help try to destroy
his family and friends - some of which he actually did do. And worse
than that, he enjoyed it.

Think about if someone did that to you personally. Caused you to turn
against everything you knew, caused you to try to kill your family.
And the change was so extreme that not only did you do it, but you
found yourself wanting to do it. Then you were rescued and woke up
from it. Now someone is saying you have to work with those same poeple
who did that to you. Can you imagine the feelings you would have
trying to do that?

THAT is the test that Rodimus is working with, not self doubt.

It is fortunate that Rodimus working with Cyclonus who took no actual
part in that effort.

So we can imagine this will be something they discuss later :)

- Preston

On 8/11/11, Sandy Panico <magicquartz@...> wrote:
> Everything checks out.  And Tucson's strategy is derived from a TF Cybertron
> episode where in order to defeat Unicron, Optimus and Galvatron realized
> they needed to team up to defeat him.  Till All Are One, was the theme of
> their. battle and thus Tucson has also come to a similar conclusion.  It
> appears insane but it was something that had to be done despite the concern
> and dislike of the strategy.  It wasn't an easy decision to make but Tucson
> showed a great courage in doing things off the beaten path.  It's very
> obvious that Rodimus is showing his weakness of self doubt which he's
> projecting off of Tucson, who will have no part of such negativity.  It's
> not that he hates Rodimus it's the fact that he knows Rodimus can overcome
> his apprehensions if he puts his mind to it.  So of course Tucson will sort
> of give him a swift nip at his backside in order to get his message across
> to Rodimus.
>
> But he too has a weakness, his beastly temper which he has had throughout
> his life.  The temper of a creature who's breath can melt mountains,
> supposedly.  The dragon was sort of Tucson's birth sign and it was no
> surprise that he would become one later on in life.
>
> So it appears the two Primes are at their greatest test.  They must both
> help each other to overcome a lack of self confidence and learn to do things
> off the beaten path and at the same time, learn to quell a temper who's
> effects could have highly destructive consequences.  Good thing Leo Prime
> came into the picture because as Rodimus and Tucson learn their hardest
> lessons he is there to keep things stable between the factions.
>
> So this is getting very interesting indeed.  It may take a while but
> eventually things will work out for everyone.
>
> Perpetually on the move and constantly busy.
>
> On Aug 11, 2011, at 7:48 AM, Super Cyclonus <supercyclonus@...> wrote:
>
>> > OOC: He was passing beneath Waspinator, on his way toward the dinosaurs.
>> > Sorry about the mixup.
>>
>> OOC: No problem. I will ignore that from Nightshift then.
>>
>> From my understanding we have Nightshift, Straightshot, Elita plus
>> Scourge and his sweeps all checking the dinosaurs trying to map out
>> some of the dinosaurs, and posibly look for any kinds of strange
>> signals like the ones reported before the maximals arrived.
>>
>> Cyclonus and Rodimus are going to work together to trace down where
>> the dinosaurs came from by following the trail of destruction they
>> left behind.
>>
>> Hydras has called Sky Shadow over for some sort of conference
>>
>> And Tuscon is awaiting Leo's reinforcements which are the Fuzors.
>>
>> There are many other Predacons, walking crawling about around the
>> dinosaurs themselves - burning them away.
>>
>> Is there anything else that I have missed?
>>
>> Today, or more likely tommorrow I will do another small time jump as
>> it will take the reinforcements several hours to get to their
>> location.
>>
>> - Preston
>>
